sen.j: 北条 時行（ほうじょう ときゆき）は、鎌倉時代末期から南北朝時代 (日本)の武将である。
sen.e: Tokiyuki HOJO was a busho (Japanese military commander) during the time from the late Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Tokiyuki HOJO was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the late Kamakura period to the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: 余分な訳は削除しました。

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府第14代執権北条高時の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Takatoki HOJO, the fourth regent of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
He was the second son of Takatoki HOJO, the fourteenth regent of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 兄である北条邦時が、正中 (日本)2年（1325年）生まれであるため、それ以後の誕生と考えられている。
sen.e: Since his older brother, Kunitoki HOJO was born in 1325, it is assumed that he was born before the year.
Since his older brother Kunitoki HOJO was born in 1325, it is assumed that he was born after that.
sen.cmt: 「それ以後」ですので、"before"ではなく"after"に修正しました。

sen.j: 後醍醐天皇が討幕運動を起こすと、幕府御家人であった足利尊氏や新田義貞らが宮方に属する。
sen.e: When Emperor Godaigo launched the anti-shogunate movement, shogunal retainers of the Kamakura bakufu including Takauji ASHIKAGA and Yoshisada NITTA sided with the imperial court.

sen.j: 鎌倉は新田義貞に攻められて高時ら北条氏は滅亡する。
sen.e: Yoshisada NITTA attacked Kamakura, and then the Hojo family including Takatoki was destroyed.

sen.j: 幕府滅亡後に後醍醐天皇による建武の新政が開始されるが、時行は鎌倉から脱出し、北条氏の守護国であった信濃国に逃れ、諏訪氏などに迎えられた。
sen.e: When the Kenmu Restoration (the new government) by Emperor Godaigo started after the fall of the bakufu, Tokiyuki escaped from Kamakura to Shinano Province governed by the Hojo clan and was received by the Suwa clan amongst others.

While Emperor Godaigo started the new government by the Kenmu Restoration after the fall of the bakufu, Tokiyuki escaped from Kamakura to Shinano Province governed by the Hojo clan and was sheltered by the Suwa clan.

sen.e: While Emperor Godaigo started the new government by the Kenmu Restoration after the fall of the bakufu, Tokiyuki escaped from Kamakura to Shinano Province governed by the Hojo clan and was sheltered by the Suwa clan.

sen.j: 北条一族の残党は各地に潜伏して蜂起した。
sen.e: The remnants of the Hojo family ware hidden in various places and then rose in revolt.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 高時の弟である北条泰家は京都で西園寺公宗らとともに各地の北条残党と連絡を取り新政の転覆と鎌倉幕府再興を図るが失敗する。
sen.e: Together with Kinmune SAIONJI in Kyoto, Takatoki's younger brother Yasuie HOJO communicated with the remnants of the Hojo family in various places to overthrow the new government and restore the Kamakura bakufu but failed.

sen.j: 建武 (日本)2年（1335年）7月 (旧暦)、10歳前後（7歳とも）であったと考えられている時行は信濃の諏訪頼重 (南北朝時代)に擁立されて挙兵し建武政権に不満を持つ武士を糾合しながら武蔵国へ入る。
sen.e: Tokiyuki who was presumably around ten (or seven) years old raised an army with the support of Yorishige SUWA (in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts) in Shinano, and entered Musashi Province while rallying commanders who were dissatisfied with the new government.

sen.j: 町田市の菅原神社 (町田市)での合戦で尊氏の弟である鎌倉将軍府執権足利直義を破り鎌倉を一時占領する。
sen.e: He beat the regent of the Kamakura bakufu Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, Takauji's younger brother in the battle in the Sugawara-jinja Shrine in Machida City and temporarily occupied Kamakura.

sen.j: 時行軍は逃げる直義を駿河国手越河原で撃破するが、京から直義救援に駆けつけた足利尊氏に、遠江国橋本、小夜の中山、相模国相模川などの戦いで連破され、時行の軍は壊滅し時行は逃亡した。
sen.e: Although the Tokiyuki army defeated escaping Tadayoshi in Tegoshigawara, Suruga Province, Tokiyuki ran away because his army was beat and destroyed by Takauji ASHIKAGA who came from Kyoto to assist Tadayoshi in battles in Hashimoto, Totoumi Province, Sayo no Nakayama (Nakayaka pass at Sayo) and Sagamigawa, Sagami Province.

sen.j: 時行が鎌倉を占領していたのはわずか20日間であるが、先代（北条氏）と後代（足利氏）の間に立った鎌倉の一時的支配者となったことから、この乱は中先代の乱と呼ばれる。
sen.e: This battle is called Nakasendai War because Tokiyuki became a ruler in Kamakura temporarily bridging between the predecessor (the Hojo clan) and the successor (the Ashikaga clan) although he occupied Kamakura for as short as 20 days.

sen.j: 尊氏は中先代の乱を契機に新政から離反し、宮方を破り京都に武家政権を設立する。
sen.e: Taking advantage of the Nakasendai War, Takauji seceded from the new government and established a military government in Kyoto after beating the imperial court forces.

sen.e: Emperor Godaigo established the Southern Court (Japan) in Yoshino and the period of the Northern and Southern Courts began.

sen.e: In 1337, Tokiyuki contacted Emperor Godaigo in Yoshino and belonged to the Southern Court after receiving the imperial order to grant amnesty to court enemies.

sen.j: 時行は北畠顕家の軍に属し、青野原の戦いなどで足利方と戦う。
sen.e: Tokiyuki belonged to the army of the Akiie KITABATAKE and fought against the Ashikaga forces in the battles such as the Battle of Aonogahara.
